justification: “After making a decision, participants then entered their confidence in that choice, on a Likert scale of 1 (No Confidence) to 5 (Full Confidence).”
Participants completed “an assessment of risk literacy (Cokely et al., 2012),” which is the Berlin Numeracy Test described in that citation.
“Decision-making is measured objectively using response accuracy… Each trial included … a two-alternative forced choice … chance performance … 50%.”

measured_by: Correlation between confidence ratings and accuracy (multilevel model)
justification: The study assessed “confidence calibration (positive association between confidence and accuracy)… we fit a multilevel model” linking confidence scores to actual accuracy.
